00085 int global_max_hosts = 15;
00086 int global_max_checks = 10;

00094 static int loading_stop = 0;

00101 static void
00102 dump_cfg_specs (struct arglist *prefs)
00103 {
00104   while (prefs && prefs->next)
00105     {
00106       printf ("%s = %s\n", prefs->name, (char *) prefs->value);
00107       prefs = prefs->next;
00108     }
00109 }
00110 
00111 static void
00112 arg_replace_value (struct arglist *arglist, char *name, int type, int length,
00113                    void *value)
00114 {
00115   if (arg_get_type (arglist, name) < 0)
00116     arg_add_value (arglist, name, type, length, value);
00117   else
00118     arg_set_value (arglist, name, length, value);
00119 }

00121 
00122 static void
00123 start_daemon_mode (void)
00124 {
00125   char *s;
00126   int fd;
00127 
00128 
00129   /* do not block the listener port for subsequent scanners */
00130   close (global_iana_socket);
00131 
00132   /* become process group leader */
00133   if (setsid () < 0)
00134     {
00135       log_write ("Warning: Cannot set process group leader (%s)\n",
00136                  strerror (errno));
00137     }
00138 
00139   if ((fd = open ("/dev/tty", O_RDWR)) >= 0)
00140     close (fd);
00141 
00142   /* no input, anymore: provide an empty-file substitute */
00143   if ((fd = open ("/dev/null", O_RDONLY)) < 0)
00144     {
00145       log_write ("Cannot open /dev/null (%s) -- aborting\n", strerror (errno));
00146       exit (0);
00147     }
00148 
00149   dup2 (fd, 0);
00150   close (fd);
00151 
00152   /* provide a dump file to collect stdout and stderr */
00153   if ((s = arg_get_value (global_preferences, "dumpfile")) == 0)
00154     s = OPENVASSD_DEBUGMSG;
00155   /* setting "-" denotes terminal mode */
00156   if (strcmp (s, "-") == 0)
00157     return;
00158 
00159   fflush (stdout);
00160   fflush (stderr);
00161 
00162   if ((fd = open (s, O_WRONLY | O_CREAT | O_APPEND, 0600)) < 0)
00163     {
00164       log_write ("Cannot create a new dumpfile %s (%s)-- aborting\n", s,
00165                  strerror (errno));
00166       exit (2);
00167     }
00168 
00169   dup2 (fd, 1);
00170   dup2 (fd, 2);
00171   close (fd);
00172   setlinebuf (stdout);
00173   setlinebuf (stderr);
00174 }
00175 
00176 
00177 static void
00178 end_daemon_mode (void)
00179 {
00180   /* clean up all processes the process group */
00181   make_em_die (SIGTERM);
00182 }
00183 
00184 static void
00185 set_globals_from_preferences (struct arglist *prefs)
00186 {
00187   char *str;
00188 
00189   if ((str = arg_get_value (prefs, "max_hosts")) != NULL)
00190     {
00191       global_max_hosts = atoi (str);
00192       if (global_max_hosts <= 0)
00193         global_max_hosts = 15;
00194     }
00195 
00196   if ((str = arg_get_value (prefs, "max_checks")) != NULL)
00197     {
00198       global_max_checks = atoi (str);
00199       if (global_max_checks <= 0)
00200         global_max_checks = 10;
00201     }
00202 
00203   arg_free (global_preferences);
00204   global_preferences = prefs;
00205 }
00206 
00207 static void
00208 sighup (int i)
00209 {
00210   reload = 1;
00211 }
00212 
00213 /*
00214  * @brief Handles a client request when the scanner is still loading.
00215  *
00216  * @param[in]   soc Client socket to send and receive from.
00217  */
00218 static void
00219 loading_client_handle (int soc)
00220 {
00221   int soc2, opt = 1;
00222   if (soc <= 0)
00223     return;
00224   soc2 = ovas_scanner_context_attach (ovas_scanner_ctx, soc);
00225   if (soc2 < 0)
00226     {
00227       close (soc);
00228       return;
00229     }
00230   setsockopt (soc, SOL_SOCKET, SO_KEEPALIVE, &opt, sizeof (opt));
00231   comm_loading (soc2);
00232   close_stream_connection (soc2);
00233 }
00234 
00235 /*
00236  * @brief Handles term signal received by loading handler child process.
00237  */
00238 static void
00239 sighand_loading_handler (int sig)
00240 {
00241   loading_stop = 1;
00242 }
00243 
00244 /*
00245  * @brief Starts a process to handle client requests while the scanner is
00246  * loading.
00247  *
00248  * @return process id of loading handler.
00249  */
00250 static pid_t
00251 loading_handler_start ()
00252 {
00253   pid_t child_pid;
00254 
00255   init_loading_shm ();
00256   child_pid = fork ();
00257   if (child_pid != 0)
00258     return child_pid;
00259   proctitle_set ("openvassd (Loading Handler)");
00260   openvas_signal (SIGTERM, sighand_loading_handler);
00261   /*
00262    * Forked process will handle client requests until parent stops it with
00263    * loading_handler_stop ().
00264    */
00265   while (1)
00266     {
00267       unsigned int lg_address;
00268       struct sockaddr_in6 address6;
00269       int soc;
00270 
00271       if (loading_stop)
00272         break;
00273       lg_address = sizeof (struct sockaddr_in6);
00274       soc = accept (global_iana_socket, (struct sockaddr *) (&address6),
00275                     &lg_address);
00276       loading_client_handle (soc);
00277     }
00278   exit (0);
00279 }
00280 
00281 /*
00282  * @brief Stops the loading handler process.
00283  *
00284  * @param[in]   handler_pid Pid of loading handler.
00285  */
00286 void
00287 loading_handler_stop (pid_t handler_pid)
00288 {
00289   int status;
00290 
00291   kill (handler_pid, SIGTERM);
00292   waitpid (handler_pid, &status, 0);
00293   destroy_loading_shm ();
00294 }
00295 
00296 /* Restarts the scanner by reloading the configuration. */
00297 static void
00298 reload_openvassd ()
00299 {
00300   struct arglist *preferences = NULL, *plugins;
00301   nvticache_t *nvti_cache;
00302   char *config_file;
00303   pid_t handler_pid;
00304 
00305   log_write ("Reloading the scanner.\n");
00306   /* Ignore SIGHUP while reloading. */
00307   openvas_signal (SIGHUP, SIG_IGN);
00308 
00309   handler_pid = loading_handler_start ();
00310   /* Free the nvti cache. */
00311   nvti_cache = arg_get_value (global_preferences, "nvticache");
00312   nvticache_free (nvti_cache);
00313   /* Reload config file. */
00314   config_file = arg_get_value (global_preferences, "config_file");
00315   preferences_init (config_file, &preferences);
00316 
00317   /* Reload the plugins */
00318   plugins = plugins_init (preferences);
00319   set_globals_from_preferences (preferences);
00320   plugins_free (global_plugins);
00321   global_plugins = plugins;
00322   loading_handler_stop (handler_pid);
00323 
00324   log_write ("Finished reloading the scanner.\n");
00325   reload = 0;
00326   openvas_signal (SIGHUP, sighup);
00327 }
00328 
00329 int
00330 check_client (char *dname)
00331 {
00332   int success = 0;
00333 
00334   if (dname != NULL && *dname != '\0')
00335     {
00336       FILE *f;
00337       if ((f = fopen (OPENVAS_STATE_DIR "/dname", "r")) == NULL)
00338         perror (OPENVAS_STATE_DIR "/dname");
00339       else
00340         {
00341           char dnameref[512];
00342 
00343           while (! success
00344                  && fgets (dnameref, sizeof (dnameref) - 1, f) != NULL)
00345             {
00346               char *p;
00347               if ((p = strchr (dnameref, '\n')) != NULL)
00348                 *p = '\0';
00349               if (strcmp (dname, dnameref) == 0)
00350                 success = 1;
00351             }
00352           if (! success)
00353             log_write
00354               ("check_client: Bad DN\nGiven DN=%s\nLast tried DN=%s\n",
00355                dname, dnameref);
00356           fclose (f);
00357         }
00358     }
00359 
00360   return success;
00361 }
00362 
00363 static int
00364 get_x509_dname (int soc, char *x509_dname, size_t x509_dname_size)
00365 {
00366   gnutls_session_t session;
00367   gnutls_x509_crt_t cert;
00368   unsigned int cert_list_size = 0;
00369   const gnutls_datum_t *cert_list;
00370   int ret;
00371 
00372   session = ovas_get_tlssession_from_connection (soc);
00373 
00374   if (gnutls_certificate_type_get (session) != GNUTLS_CRT_X509)
00375     {
00376       log_write ("Certificate is not an X.509 certificate.");
00377       return -1;
00378     }
00379   cert_list = gnutls_certificate_get_peers (session, &cert_list_size);
00380   if (cert_list_size == 0)
00381     return -1;
00382 
00383   gnutls_x509_crt_init (&cert);
00384   if ((ret = gnutls_x509_crt_import (cert, &cert_list[0],
00385                                      GNUTLS_X509_FMT_DER)) < 0)
00386     {
00387       log_write ("certificate decoding error: %s\n", gnutls_strerror (ret));
00388       gnutls_x509_crt_deinit (cert);
00389       return -1;
00390     }
00391   if ((ret = gnutls_x509_crt_get_dn (cert, x509_dname, &x509_dname_size)) < 0)
00392     {
00393       log_write ("couldn't get subject from certificate: %s\n",
00394                  gnutls_strerror (ret));
00395       gnutls_x509_crt_deinit (cert);
00396       return -1;
00397     }
00398   gnutls_x509_crt_deinit (cert);
00399   return 0;
00400 }
00401 
00402 static void
00403 handle_client (struct arglist *globals)
00404 {
00405   struct arglist *prefs = arg_get_value (globals, "preferences");
00406 
00407   /* Become process group leader and the like ... */
00408   start_daemon_mode ();
00409 wait:
00410   comm_wait_order (globals);
00411   preferences_reset_cache ();
00412   ntp_timestamp_scan_starts (globals);
00413   attack_network (globals);
00414   ntp_timestamp_scan_ends (globals);
00415   comm_terminate (globals);
00416   if (arg_get_value (prefs, "ntp_keep_communication_alive"))
00417     {
00418       log_write ("Kept alive connection");
00419       goto wait;
00420     }
00421 }
00422 
00423 static void
00424 scanner_thread (struct arglist *globals)
00425 {
00426   struct arglist *prefs = arg_get_value (globals, "preferences");
00427   char asciiaddr[INET6_ADDRSTRLEN], x509_dname[512] = { '\0' };
00428   int opt = 1, soc2 = -1, nice_retval, family, soc;
00429   void *addr = arg_get_value (globals, "client_address");
00430   struct sockaddr_in *saddr = NULL;
00431   struct sockaddr_in6 *s6addr = NULL;
00432 
00433   family = GPOINTER_TO_SIZE (arg_get_value (globals, "family"));
00434   soc = GPOINTER_TO_SIZE (arg_get_value (globals, "global_socket"));
00435   if (family == AF_INET)
00436     {
00437       saddr = (struct sockaddr_in *) addr;
00438       inet_ntop (AF_INET,  &saddr->sin_addr, asciiaddr, sizeof(asciiaddr));
00439     }
00440   else
00441     {
00442       s6addr = (struct sockaddr_in6 *) addr;
00443       inet_ntop (AF_INET6, &s6addr->sin6_addr, asciiaddr, sizeof (asciiaddr));
00444     }
00445   proctitle_set ("openvassd: Serving %s", asciiaddr);
00446 
00447   /* Everyone runs with a nicelevel of 10 */
00448   if (preferences_benice (prefs))
00449     {
00450       errno = 0;
00451       nice_retval = nice (10);
00452       if (nice_retval == -1 && errno != 0)
00453         {
00454           log_write ("Unable to renice process: %d", errno);
00455         }
00456     }
00457 
00458   /* Close the scanner thread - it is useless for us now */
00459   close (global_iana_socket);
00460 
00461   soc2 = ovas_scanner_context_attach (ovas_scanner_ctx, soc);
00462   if (soc2 < 0)
00463     goto shutdown_and_exit;
00464 
00465   /* FIXME: The pre-gnutls code optionally printed information about
00466    * the peer's certificate at this point.
00467    */
00468 
00469   setsockopt (soc, SOL_SOCKET, SO_KEEPALIVE, &opt, sizeof (opt));
00470   /* arg_set_value *replaces* an existing value, but it shouldn't fail here */
00471   (void) arg_set_value (globals, "global_socket", -1, GSIZE_TO_POINTER (soc2));
00472 
00473   if (comm_init (soc2) < 0)
00474     {
00475       close_stream_connection (soc);
00476       exit (0);
00477     }
00478 
00479   /* Get X.509 cert subject name */
00480   if (get_x509_dname (soc2, x509_dname, sizeof (x509_dname)) != 0)
00481     goto shutdown_and_exit;
00482 
00483   if (!check_client (x509_dname))
00484     {
00485       auth_printf (globals, "Bad login attempt !\n");
00486       log_write ("bad login attempt from %s\n", asciiaddr);
00487       goto shutdown_and_exit;
00488     }
00489   handle_client (globals);
00490 
00491 shutdown_and_exit:
00492   if (soc2 >= 0)
00493     close_stream_connection (soc2);
00494   else
00495     {
00496       shutdown (soc, 2);
00497       close (soc);
00498     }
00499 
00500   /* Kill left overs */
00501   end_daemon_mode ();
00502   exit (0);
00503 }
00504 
00505 static void
00506 init_ssl_ctx (const char *priority, const char *dhparams)
00507 {
00508   if (openvas_SSL_init () < 0)
00509     {
00510       log_write ("Could not initialize openvas SSL!\n");
00511       exit (1);
00512     }
00513 
00514   /* Only initialize ovas_scanner_ctx once */
00515   if (ovas_scanner_ctx == NULL)
00516     {
00517       char *cert, *key, *passwd, *ca_file;
00518 
00519       ca_file = preferences_get_string (global_preferences, "ca_file");
00520       if (ca_file == NULL)
00521         {
00522           log_write ("Missing ca_file - Did you run openvas-mkcert?\n");
00523           exit (1);
00524         }
00525       cert = preferences_get_string (global_preferences, "cert_file");
00526       if (cert == NULL)
00527         {
00528           log_write ("Missing cert_file - Did you run openvas-mkcert?\n");
00529           exit (1);
00530         }
00531       key = preferences_get_string (global_preferences, "key_file");
00532       if (key == NULL)
00533         {
00534           log_write ("Missing key_file - Did you run openvas-mkcert?\n");
00535           exit (1);
00536         }
00537 
00538       passwd = preferences_get_string (global_preferences, "pem_password");
00539       ovas_scanner_ctx = ovas_scanner_context_new
00540                           (OPENVAS_ENCAPS_TLScustom, cert, key, passwd, ca_file,
00541                            priority, dhparams);
00542       if (!ovas_scanner_ctx)
00543         {
00544           log_write ("Could not create ovas_scanner_ctx\n");
00545           exit (1);
00546         }
00547     }
00548 }
00549 
00550 /*
00551  * @brief Reloads the scanner if a reload was requested.
00552  */
00553 static void
00554 check_and_reload ()
00555 {
00556   if (reload != 0)
00557     {
00558       proctitle_set ("openvassd: Reloading");
00559       reload_openvassd ();
00560       proctitle_set ("openvassd: Waiting for incoming connections");
00561     }
00562 }
00563 
00564 static void
00565 main_loop ()
00566 {
00567   log_write ("openvassd %s started\n", OPENVASSD_VERSION);
00568   proctitle_set ("openvassd: Waiting for incoming connections");
00569   for (;;)
00570     {
00571       int soc;
00572       int family;
00573       unsigned int lg_address;
00574       struct sockaddr_in6 address6;
00575       struct sockaddr_in6 *p_addr;
00576       struct arglist *globals;
00577       struct addrinfo *ai;
00578 
00579       check_and_reload ();
00580       wait_for_children1 ();
00581       ai = arg_get_value (g_options, "addr");
00582       lg_address = sizeof (struct sockaddr_in6);
00583       soc = accept (global_iana_socket, (struct sockaddr *) (&address6),
00584                     &lg_address);
00585       if (soc == -1)
00586         continue;
00587 
00588       /*
00589        * MA: you cannot share an open SSL connection through fork/multithread
00590        * The SSL connection shall be open _after_ the fork */
00591       globals = emalloc (sizeof (struct arglist));
00592       arg_add_value (globals, "global_socket", ARG_INT, -1,
00593                      GSIZE_TO_POINTER (soc));
00594 
00595       arg_add_value (globals, "plugins", ARG_ARGLIST, -1, global_plugins);
00596       arg_add_value (globals, "preferences", ARG_ARGLIST, -1, global_preferences);
00597 
00598       p_addr = emalloc (sizeof (struct sockaddr_in6));
00599       family = ai->ai_family;
00600       memcpy (p_addr, &address6, sizeof (address6));
00601       arg_add_value (globals, "client_address", ARG_PTR, -1, p_addr);
00602       arg_add_value (globals, "family", ARG_INT, -1, GSIZE_TO_POINTER (family));
00603 
00604       /* we do not want to create an io thread, yet so the last argument is -1 */
00605       if (create_process ((process_func_t) scanner_thread, globals) < 0)
00606         {
00607           log_write ("Could not fork - client won't be served");
00608           sleep (2);
00609         }
00610       close (soc);
00611       arg_free (globals);
00612     }
00613 }
00614 
00626 static int
00627 init_network (int port, int *sock, struct addrinfo addr)
00628 {
00629   int option = 1;
00630 
00631   if (addr.ai_family == AF_INET)
00632     ((struct sockaddr_in *) (addr.ai_addr))->sin_port = htons (port);
00633   else
00634     ((struct sockaddr_in6 *) (addr.ai_addr))->sin6_port = htons (port);
00635   if ((*sock = socket (addr.ai_family, SOCK_STREAM, 0)) == -1)
00636     {
00637       int ec = errno;
00638       log_write ("socket(AF_INET): %s", strerror (ec));
00639       exit (1);
00640     }
00641 
00642   setsockopt (*sock, SOL_SOCKET, SO_REUSEADDR, &option, sizeof (int));
00643   if (bind (*sock, (struct sockaddr *) (addr.ai_addr), addr.ai_addrlen) == -1)
00644     {
00645       log_write ("bind() failed : %s\n", strerror (errno));
00646       exit (1);
00647     }
00648 
00649   if (listen (*sock, 10) == -1)
00650     {
00651       log_write ("listen() failed : %s\n", strerror (errno));
00652       shutdown (*sock, 2);
00653       close (*sock);
00654       exit (1);
00655     }
00656   return (0);
00657 }
00658 
00659 static void
00660 init_plugins (struct arglist *options)
00661 {
00662   struct arglist *preferences, *plugins;
00663 
00664   preferences = arg_get_value (options, "preferences");
00665   plugins = plugins_init (preferences);
00666 
00667   arg_replace_value (options, "plugins", ARG_ARGLIST, -1, plugins);
00668   plugins_free (global_plugins);
00669   global_plugins = plugins;
00670 }
00671 
00677 static int
00678 init_openvassd (struct arglist *options, int first_pass, int stop_early,
00679                 int dont_fork)
00680 {
00681   int isck = -1;
00682   struct arglist *preferences = NULL;
00683   int scanner_port = GPOINTER_TO_SIZE (arg_get_value (options, "scanner_port"));
00684   char *config_file = arg_get_value (options, "config_file");
00685   struct addrinfo *addr = arg_get_value (options, "addr");
00686 
00687   preferences_init (config_file, &preferences);
00688 
00689   log_init (arg_get_value (preferences, "logfile"));
00690   if (dont_fork == FALSE)
00691     setup_legacy_log_handler (log_vwrite);
00692 
00693   if (!stop_early)
00694     {
00695       if (first_pass != 0)
00696         init_network (scanner_port, &isck, *addr);
00697     }
00698 
00699   if (first_pass && !stop_early)
00700     {
00701       openvas_signal (SIGSEGV, sighandler);
00702       openvas_signal (SIGCHLD, sighand_chld);
00703       openvas_signal (SIGTERM, sighandler);
00704       openvas_signal (SIGINT, sighandler);
00705       openvas_signal (SIGHUP, sighup);
00706       openvas_signal (SIGUSR1, sighandler);     /* openvassd dies, not its sons */
00707       openvas_signal (SIGPIPE, SIG_IGN);
00708     }
00709 
00710   arg_replace_value (options, "isck", ARG_INT, sizeof (gpointer),
00711                      GSIZE_TO_POINTER (isck));
00712   arg_replace_value (options, "preferences", ARG_ARGLIST, -1, preferences);
00713   set_globals_from_preferences (preferences);
00714 
00715   return 0;
00716 }
00717 
00718 static void
00719 set_daemon_mode ()
00720 {
00721   /* Close stdin, stdout and stderr */
00722   int i = open ("/dev/null", O_RDONLY, 0640);
00723   if (dup2 (i, STDIN_FILENO) != STDIN_FILENO)
00724     log_write ("Could not redirect stdin to /dev/null: %s\n", strerror (errno));
00725   if (dup2 (i, STDOUT_FILENO) != STDOUT_FILENO)
00726     log_write ("Could not redirect stdout to /dev/null: %s\n",
00727                strerror (errno));
00728   if (dup2 (i, STDERR_FILENO) != STDERR_FILENO)
00729     log_write ("Could not redirect stderr to /dev/null: %s\n",
00730                strerror (errno));
00731   close (i);
00732   if (fork ())
00733     exit (0);
00734   setsid ();
00735 }
00736 
00737 static void
00738 gcrypt_init ()
00739 {
00740   if (gcry_control (GCRYCTL_ANY_INITIALIZATION_P))
00741     return;
00742   gcry_check_version (NULL);
00743   gcry_control (GCRYCTL_SUSPEND_SECMEM_WARN);
00744   gcry_control (GCRYCTL_INIT_SECMEM, 16384, 0);
00745   gcry_control (GCRYCTL_RESUME_SECMEM_WARN);
00746   gcry_control (GCRYCTL_INITIALIZATION_FINISHED);
00747 }
00748 
00754 int
00755 main (int argc, char *argv[])
00756 {
00757   int exit_early = 0, scanner_port = 9391;
00758   pid_t handler_pid;
00759   char *myself;
00760   struct arglist *options = emalloc (sizeof (struct arglist));
00761   struct addrinfo *mysaddr;
00762   struct addrinfo hints;
00763   struct addrinfo ai;
00764   struct sockaddr_in saddr;
00765   struct sockaddr_in6 s6addr;
00766 
00767   proctitle_init (argc, argv);
00768   gcrypt_init ();
00769 
00770   if ((myself = strrchr (*argv, '/')) == 0)
00771     myself = *argv;
00772   else
00773     myself++;
00774 
00775   static gboolean display_version = FALSE;
00776   static gboolean dont_fork = FALSE;
00777   static gchar *address = NULL;
00778   static gchar *port = NULL;
00779   static gchar *config_file = NULL;
00780   static gchar *gnutls_priorities = "NORMAL";
00781   static gchar *dh_params = NULL;
00782   static gboolean print_specs = FALSE;
00783   static gboolean print_sysconfdir = FALSE;
00784   static gboolean only_cache = FALSE;
00785   GError *error = NULL;
00786   GOptionContext *option_context;
00787   static GOptionEntry entries[] = {
00788     {"version", 'V', 0, G_OPTION_ARG_NONE, &display_version,
00789      "Display version information", NULL},
00790     {"foreground", 'f', 0, G_OPTION_ARG_NONE, &dont_fork,
00791      "Do not run in daemon mode but stay in foreground", NULL},
00792     {"listen", 'a', 0, G_OPTION_ARG_STRING, &address,
00793      "Listen on <address>", "<address>"},
00794     {"port", 'p', 0, G_OPTION_ARG_STRING, &port,
00795      "Use port number <number>", "<number>"},
00796     {"config-file", 'c', 0, G_OPTION_ARG_FILENAME, &config_file,
00797      "Configuration file", "<.rcfile>"},
00798     {"cfg-specs", 's', 0, G_OPTION_ARG_NONE, &print_specs,
00799      "Print configuration settings", NULL},
00800     {"sysconfdir", 'y', 0, G_OPTION_ARG_NONE, &print_sysconfdir,
00801      "Print system configuration directory (set at compile time)", NULL},
00802     {"only-cache", 'C', 0, G_OPTION_ARG_NONE, &only_cache,
00803      "Exit once the NVT cache has been initialized or updated", NULL},
00804     {"gnutls-priorities", '\0', 0, G_OPTION_ARG_STRING, &gnutls_priorities,
00805      "GnuTLS priorities string", "<string>"},
00806     {"dh-params", '\0', 0, G_OPTION_ARG_STRING, &dh_params,
00807      "Diffie-Hellman parameters file", "<string>"},
00808     {NULL}
00809   };
00810 
00811   option_context =
00812     g_option_context_new ("- Scanner of the Open Vulnerability Assessment System");
00813   g_option_context_add_main_entries (option_context, entries, NULL);
00814   if (!g_option_context_parse (option_context, &argc, &argv, &error))
00815     {
00816       g_print ("%s\n\n", error->message);
00817       exit (0);
00818     }
00819   g_option_context_free (option_context);
00820 
00821   if (print_sysconfdir)
00822     {
00823       g_print ("%s\n", SYSCONFDIR);
00824       exit (0);
00825     }
00826 
00827   /* Switch to UTC so that OTP times are always in UTC. */
00828   if (setenv ("TZ", "utc 0", 1) == -1)
00829     {
00830       g_print ("%s\n\n", strerror (errno));
00831       exit (0);
00832     }
00833   tzset ();
00834 
00835   if (print_specs)
00836     exit_early = 2;           /* no cipher initialization */
00837 
00838   if (address != NULL)
00839     {
00840       memset (&hints, 0, sizeof (hints));
00841       hints.ai_socktype = SOCK_STREAM;
00842       hints.ai_protocol = IPPROTO_TCP;
00843       hints.ai_flags = AI_NUMERICHOST;
00844       if (getaddrinfo (address, NULL, &hints, &mysaddr))
00845         {
00846           printf ("Invalid IP address.\n");
00847           printf ("Please use %s --help for more information.\n", myself);
00848           exit (0);
00849         }
00850       /* deep copy */
00851       ai.ai_family = mysaddr->ai_family;
00852       if (ai.ai_family == AF_INET)
00853         {
00854           memcpy (&saddr, mysaddr->ai_addr, mysaddr->ai_addrlen);
00855           ai.ai_addr = (struct sockaddr *) &saddr;
00856         }
00857       else
00858         {
00859           memcpy (&s6addr, mysaddr->ai_addr, mysaddr->ai_addrlen);
00860           ai.ai_addr = (struct sockaddr *) &s6addr;
00861         }
00862       ai.ai_family = mysaddr->ai_family;
00863       ai.ai_protocol = mysaddr->ai_protocol;
00864       ai.ai_socktype = mysaddr->ai_socktype;
00865       ai.ai_addrlen = mysaddr->ai_addrlen;
00866       freeaddrinfo (mysaddr);
00867     }
00868   else
00869     {
00870       /* Default to IPv4 */
00871       /*Warning: Not filling all the fields */
00872       saddr.sin_addr.s_addr = INADDR_ANY;
00873       saddr.sin_family = ai.ai_family = AF_INET;
00874       ai.ai_addrlen = sizeof (saddr);
00875       ai.ai_addr = (struct sockaddr *) &saddr;
00876     }
00877 
00878   if (port != NULL)
00879     {
00880       scanner_port = atoi (port);
00881       if ((scanner_port <= 0) || (scanner_port >= 65536))
00882         {
00883           printf ("Invalid port specification.\n");
00884           printf ("Please use %s --help for more information.\n", myself);
00885           exit (1);
00886         }
00887     }
00888 
00889   if (display_version)
00890     {
00891       printf ("OpenVAS Scanner %s\n", OPENVASSD_VERSION);
00892       printf
00893         ("Nessus origin: (C) 2004 Renaud Deraison <deraison@nessus.org>\n");
00894       printf
00895         ("Most new code since OpenVAS: (C) 2013 Greenbone Networks GmbH\n");
00896       printf ("License GPLv2: GNU GPL version 2\n");
00897       printf
00898         ("This is free software: you are free to change and redistribute it.\n"
00899          "There is NO WARRANTY, to the extent permitted by law.\n\n");
00900       exit (0);
00901     }
00902 
00903   if (config_file != NULL)
00904     arg_add_value (options, "acc_hint", ARG_INT, sizeof (int), (void *) 1);
00905 
00906   if (!config_file)
00907     {
00908       config_file = emalloc (strlen (OPENVASSD_CONF) + 1);
00909       strncpy (config_file, OPENVASSD_CONF, strlen (OPENVASSD_CONF));
00910     }
00911 
00912   arg_add_value (options, "scanner_port", ARG_INT, sizeof (gpointer),
00913                  GSIZE_TO_POINTER (scanner_port));
00914   arg_add_value (options, "config_file", ARG_STRING, strlen (config_file),
00915                  config_file);
00916   arg_add_value (options, "addr", ARG_PTR, -1, &ai);
00917 
00918   if (only_cache)
00919     {
00920       init_openvassd (options, 0, 1, dont_fork);
00921       init_plugins (options);
00922       exit (0);
00923     }
00924 
00925   init_openvassd (options, 1, exit_early, dont_fork);
00926   g_options = options;
00927   global_iana_socket = GPOINTER_TO_SIZE (arg_get_value (options, "isck"));
00928   global_plugins = arg_get_value (options, "plugins");
00929 
00930   /* special treatment */
00931   if (print_specs)
00932     dump_cfg_specs (global_preferences);
00933   if (exit_early)
00934     exit (0);
00935 
00936   init_ssl_ctx (gnutls_priorities, dh_params);
00937   // Daemon mode:
00938   if (dont_fork == FALSE)
00939     set_daemon_mode ();
00940   pidfile_create ("openvassd");
00941   handler_pid = loading_handler_start ();
00942   init_plugins (options);
00943   loading_handler_stop (handler_pid);
00944   main_loop ();
00945   exit (0);
00946 }
Generated on 23 Oct 2015 for OpenVAS Scanner by  1.6.1
